problem.prob_desc:
24. 매개변수 $t(t  \gt 0)$으로 나타내어진 곡선 $$x = \ln(t^3 + 1), \quad y = \sin\pi t$$에서 $t=1$일 때, $\dfrac{dy}{dx}$의 값은? [3점]
① $-\dfrac{1}{3}\pi$ ② $-\dfrac{2}{3}\pi$ ③ $-\pi$ ④ $-\dfrac{4}{3}\pi$ ⑤ $-\dfrac{5}{3}\pi$

gpt-5-codex.title: Differentiate parametric equations
gpt-5-codex.body: Compute derivatives with respect to t: dx/dt = d/dt[ln(t^3+1)] = (3t^2)/(t^3+1), dy/dt = d/dt[sin(πt)] = π cos(πt). Then dy/dx = (dy/dt)/(dx/dt) = π cos(πt) * (t^3 + 1)/(3t^2).

gpt-5.title: Differentiate x(t) and y(t)
gpt-5.body: Compute derivatives with respect to t: dy/dt = π cos(πt), dx/dt = d/dt[ln(t^3+1)] = (3t^2)/(t^3+1).

gpt-5.title: Select the option
gpt-5.body: The value -2π/3 corresponds to option ②.

claude-opus-4.5.title: Find dy/dt and dx/dt
claude-opus-4.5.body:
Given parametric equations:
- x = ln(t³ + 1)
- y = sin(πt)

For dy/dx with parametric equations: dy/dx = (dy/dt)/(dx/dt)

Calculate dy/dt:
dy/dt = d/dt[sin(πt)] = π·cos(πt)

Calculate dx/dt:
dx/dt = d/dt[ln(t³ + 1)] = (3t²)/(t³ + 1)

gemini-3-pro.title: Differentiate x and y with respect to t
gemini-3-pro.body:
To find $\frac{dy}{dx}$, we first compute the derivatives of $x$ and $y$ with respect to the parameter $t$. 
For $x = \ln(t^3 + 1)$, using the chain rule:
$$ \frac{dx}{dt} = \frac{3t^2}{t^3 + 1} $$
For $y = \sin\pi t$, using the chain rule:
$$ \frac{dy}{dt} = \pi \cos\pi t $$

gemini-3-pro.title: Calculate dy/dx at t=1
gemini-3-pro.body:
Using the formula for parametric differentiation, $\frac{dy}{dx} = \frac{\frac{dy}{dt}}{\frac{dx}{dt}}$. We evaluate the derivatives at $t=1$:
$$ \frac{dx}{dt}\bigg|_{t=1} = \frac{3(1)^2}{1^3 + 1} = \frac{3}{2} $$
$$ \frac{dy}{dt}\bigg|_{t=1} = \pi \cos\pi = \pi(-1) = -\pi $$
Substituting these values gives:
$$ \frac{dy}{dx} = \frac{-\pi}{\frac{3}{2}} = -\frac{2}{3}\pi $$

grok-4-fast.title: Recall parametric derivative formula
grok-4-fast.body: For parametric equations x(t) and y(t), dy/dx = (dy/dt) / (dx/dt).

grok-4-fast.title: Compute dx/dt and dy/dt
grok-4-fast.body: dx/dt = d/dt [ln(t³ + 1)] = (3t²)/(t³ + 1). dy/dt = d/dt [sin(π t)] = π cos(π t).
